name: EditLegacyTimeEntry
description:
Edit a legacy time tracked entry for a task in ClickUp.

Use this tool to modify an existing time entry on a specific task using the legacy endpoint in ClickUp. It's recommended to use newer APIs for time tracking, but this can be used for older integrations.

parameters.name: task_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the task for which the legacy time entry is being edited. This is required to specify the task in ClickUp.

parameters.name: legacy_time_interval_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the time interval to be edited.

parameters.name: start_timestamp
parameters.description: The start time of the time entry as a Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

parameters.name: end_time_epoch
parameters.description: The end time of the tracked interval in Unix epoch format. It marks when the time entry should conclude.

parameters.name: time_duration_in_seconds
parameters.description: The total time duration (in seconds) for the time entry to be updated. This modifies the tracked time for a specific task.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The Workspace ID required when custom task IDs are used. This must be set if `custom_task_ids` is `true`.

value_schema.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

parameters.name: use_custom_task_ids
parameters.description: Set to true to reference a task by its custom task ID.

value_schema.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the clickup API.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

value_schema.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

value_schema.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
